text: today I'm making delicious
buttermilk biscuits what do you think
about that I don't often make biscuits
for breakfast but when I do I want them
to be simple and easy to make and fast
and this recipe is all of those things
so I'm making it in a food processor
which makes it a lot easier and quicker
to come together measure four cups of
all-purpose flour add 2 tablespoons of
sugar 5 teaspoons of baking powder or
the lot of Leben our biscuits have a lot
of leavener because they're kind of
heavy with butter and you want to make
sure that they puff up really nicely so
it's a little more leavener than I would
normally use say in a cake as far as
like per quarter teaspoon of baking soda
and then 2 teaspoons of coarse salt
don't ruin your biscuits by adding too
much salt process to combine all your
dry ingredients then you add your butter
it's two sticks of butter cold unsalted
butter cut up into little cubes and then
you pulse it kind of like you're making
pie crusts until it's the texture of
coarse crumbs with some pieces of the
butter being the size of small piece and
add one and a half cups of buttermilk
and pulse just until it holds together
at this point I think that because a lot
of its moistened I can just put it on to
my work surface dump your biscuit
mixture right out onto the surface you
need your biscuit dough just until it
holds together right now it's not so
evenly mixed and there's flour on the
bottom you want it fully combined and
now just Pat your dough into a 1-inch
thick rectangle around it doesn't really
matter use a 2 inch biscuit cutter to
cut your biscuits out do it as close
together as possible because you can
pack the scraps together once and cut
out more but you don't really want to do
it more than that have your oven
preheating to 450 degrees want to brush
these with some butter for deliciousness
and golden this
we'll need to bake for about 12 to 15
minutes they should be puffed light
golden brown and cooked through Oh guys
look at that
puffed light golden warm out of the oven
couldn't be better
I also have this delicious strawberry
butter that I made by mixing together
some strawberry jam and butter it makes
a perfect thing even more perfect
